definition: to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.chinese: 你们大部分人采访报道过我。

sentences.english: Yang Hong and accepts the director East on-the-spot coverage in the Nanjing Television station.
sentences.chinese: 杨鸿并在南京电视台内接受主持人东方现场采访。

sentences.english: Except whenbeing interviewed at D with Bill Gates.
sentences.chinese: 除了和盖茨同台被采访的时候。

sentences.english: And you know what? I really like both interviews.
sentences.chinese: 你知道吗，这两种形式的采访我都很喜欢。

sentences.english: Names in this story have been changed to protect the interviewees.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道中的人名都被改了，以保护被采访人。

sentences.english: Half of them are assigned to the blunder condition.
sentences.chinese: 实验中出现了采访者失态的环节。

sentences.english: What's Leader's attitude inside the room while not being interviewed.
sentences.chinese: 小队正在房间外，采访已启始时是怎样的？

sentences.english: As you know, there are more than 2,000 journalists from China and abroad covering the NPC and CPPCC sessions.
sentences.chinese: 据我知道，参加两会采访的中外记者有2000多名。

sentences.english: I worked as a legman for the Channel 5 news for 4 years.
sentences.chinese: 我作新闻5台的现场采访记者已经4年了。

sentences.english: Currid’s conclusion, based on dozens of interviews, is less sublime.
sentences.chinese: 克里德做了几十个采访后得出的结论可没有这么高尚。

sentences.english: The interview shows that the 79-year old has lost none of his charm.
sentences.chinese: 这次采访表明，这位79岁的老人还是那样充满魅力。

sentences.english: In the qin day under the assistance, WenXue they interview to QinLang.
sentences.chinese: 在秦天的协助下，温雪他们采访到了秦朗。

sentences.english: In this interview, Dr. Kase talks about baby boomers and leadership.
sentences.chinese: 在采访中，凯瑟博士会讨论婴儿潮和领导能力。

sentences.english: Therefore, not all answers to the interview questions are addressed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 因此，并非所有对采访问题的回答都会在本文中给出。

sentences.english: In October, when the German television station to my interview with wire stunt team.
sentences.chinese: 德国的电视台来我队采访威亚特技。

sentences.english: That night I listened to a call-in program on the radio;
sentences.chinese: 那天夜里我收听了广播电台的采访节目。

definition: to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
to refer to/to speak about/to talk about
to express/to show/to say/to state/to indicate/to mean
to give an interview/to be interviewed/to respond to (questions, a survey etc)
